snippet: New York State legislation to extend financial aid to undocumented college students has drawn only cautious remarks from Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Republican lawmakers.
abstract: Proposals for New York State legislation that would extend financial aid to undocumented college students has drawn only cautious remarks from Gov Andrew M Cuomo and Republican lawmakers, with immigration still a contentious issue around the country; advocates for the so-called Dream Act have the backing of New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, but have been unable to win public support from Cuomo, a Democrat who has generally been supportive of immigrants but faces political pitfalls.
lead_paragraph: New York State legislation to extend financial aid to undocumented college students has drawn only cautious remarks from Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Republican lawmakers.

headline.seo: Cuomo and Republicans Silent on New York Dream Act
headline.main: Cuomo and G.O.P. Quiet So Far on Tuition Aid for Illegal Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Cuomo and G.O.P. Quiet So Far on Tuition Aid for Illegal Immigrants

keywords.value: Dream Act (Development, Relief and Education for Minors Act)
keywords.name: subject
